page.title: 06AMERSHAM HIGH STREET
page.content: When the railways came in 1894 to what we call Amersham-on-the-hill,New,or Top Amersham,most of the amenities, shops and houses were built near the station.This has left Old Amersham largely untouched,with its beautiful High street which still has the annual fair granted by charter from King John in 1200. There are many interesting houses,too numerous to mention here.Some have Georgian facades,though they are much older,(Elizabethan wall paintings were recently discovered in one.) The market hall was given by squire Drake from Shardeloes in 1682;it was, and still is, used for meetings upstairs,and the covered part underneath has market stalls twice a week. Of the 39 shops, 11 were gift,11 Antique and 13 dress,with 8 others.
